name: connectionsExample
description: This endpoint returns a downstream example of a given resource.

x-apideck-consumer-id.description: ID of the consumer which you want to get or push data from

x-apideck-app-id.description: The ID of your Unify application

service_id.description: Service ID of the resource to return

$ul: **data**
**example_response**: Example response from the downstream API
**resource**
**downstream_id**: ID of the resource in the Connector's API (downstream)
**downstream_name**: Name of the resource in the Connector's API (downstream)
**id**: ID of the resource, typically a lowercased version of name.
**name**: Name of the resource (plural)
**status**: Status of the resource. Resources with status live or beta are callable.
**service_id**: Service provider identifier
**unified_api**: Name of Apideck Unified API
**status**: HTTP Response Status
**status_code**: HTTP Response Status Code
**detail**: Contains parameter or domain specific information related to the error and why it occurred.
**error**: Contains an explanation of the status_code as defined in HTTP/1.1 standard (RFC 7231)
**message**: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.
**ref**: Link to documentation of error type
**status_code**: HTTP status code
**type_name**: The type of error returned
